availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Brockenbrough Phelps (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier - Lt. 1st Ky Inf.)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James W. Phelps and Elizabeth Phelps. Farmer in Boone County, Missouri, in 1850. Graduated from Lexington Law School in Lexington, Rockbridge County, Virginia, in 1856. Attorney in Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, in 1860. Attorney in Covington in 1861. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a Lieutenant from 1861 to January 10, 1862. Died from injuries sustained at the Battle of Dranesville, Fairfax County, Virginia, on December 22, 1861.
